verses.text: 有一天，耶穌在一個地方祈禱，祈禱完了，有一個門徒對他說：「主啊，求你教導我們禱告，像約翰教導他的門徒一樣。」

words.note: Similar to 祈求, but often implies a more formal or reverent act of prayer.
A title of reverence for God or Jesus.
Refers to formal prayer, often to God.
一樣 (yīyàng) means 'the same'.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「你們禱告的時候，要說：『父啊，願你的名被尊為聖，願你的國降臨（有些抄本在此有「願你的旨意行在地上，如同行在天上」一句）；

words.note: Here, referring to God the Father.
Refers to the Kingdom of God.

verses.text: 我們需用的食物，求你每天賜給我們；

words.note: 每天 (měitiān) means 'every day'.
Implies giving from a superior to an inferior.

verses.text: 赦免我們的罪，因為我們也饒恕所有虧負我們的人；不要讓我們陷入試探（有些抄本在此有「救我們脫離那惡者」一句）。』」

words.note: Means to treat unfairly or cause harm/loss.

verses.text: 耶穌又對他們說：「你們當中，誰有朋友半夜去找他，說：『請你借給我三個餅，

words.note: Refers to a flatbread or loaf.

verses.text: 因為我有一個朋友旅行來到我這裡，我沒有甚麼可以招待他。』
而他卻在裡面回答：『不要麻煩我，門已經關好了，孩子也跟我在床上了，我不能起來拿給你。』
我告訴你們，即使不因為他是朋友而起來給他，也會因為他厚顏地直求，而起來照他所需要的給他。

words.note: Connects clauses, indicating result or further action.
Lit. 'thick-faced'; refers to brazen persistence rather than negative shame.
Implies straightforward and persistent asking.
Connects clauses, indicating result or further action.
Used before a verb to form a nominal phrase.

verses.text: 我又告訴你們，你們祈求，就給你們；尋找，就尋見；叩門，就給你們開門。

words.note: Formal term for prayer or earnest request.
Common word, but heavily used in biblical contexts like 'seek and you will find'.
Means 'to find after seeking', a common biblical phrase.
A specific phrase often found in biblical teachings, 'knock and it will be opened'.

verses.text: 因為所有祈求的就得著，尋找的就尋見，叩門的就給他開門。

words.note: Formal term for prayer or earnest request.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'those who pray/ask'.
Means 'to obtain (what was sought)', a common biblical phrase.
Common word, but heavily used in biblical contexts like 'seek and you will find'.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'those who seek'.
Means 'to find after seeking', a common biblical phrase.
A specific phrase often found in biblical teachings, 'knock and it will be opened'.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'those who knock'.

verses.text: 你們中間作父親的，哪有兒子求魚（較後期的抄本多數作「兒子要餅，卻給他石頭呢？），反拿蛇給他呢？
或求雞蛋，反給他蠍子呢？
你們雖然不好，尚且知道把好東西給自己的兒女，何況天父，豈不更把聖靈賜給求他的人嗎？」

words.note: More formal or literary than '還' (hái).
Etymologically from 'east' and 'west'.
A title for God in Christianity.
Used to express rhetorical question or strong affirmation.
Refers to the Holy Spirit of God.
賜 (cì) is often used in formal or religious contexts.

verses.text: 神的能力趕鬼耶穌趕出一個啞巴鬼，鬼既出去，啞巴就說起話來，眾人都希奇。

words.note: Refers to the divine being, God.
A verb-object compound.
A verb-complement construction.
Often used in more formal or literary contexts.
An idiomatic verbal phrase meaning 'to start talking'.
Often means to find something strange and wonderful.

verses.heading: Jesus and Beelzebul

verses.text: 有人說：「他靠鬼王別西卜趕鬼。」

words.definition: to rely on, by means of

words.note: A name for a chief demon or Satan.
A verb-object compound.

verses.text: 又有人試探他，向他求一個從天上來的神蹟。

words.note: Often refers to testing God or being tempted by evil.
Refers to the realm of God or the sky.
Literally 'divine trace' or 'divine sign'.

verses.text: 耶穌知道他們的心意，就對他們說：「如果一個國家自相紛爭，就必定荒涼；如果一個家庭自相為敵，就必然敗落。

words.note: Refers to one's thoughts or true intentions.
Implies a state of neglect and decay.
Describes a state of ruin or collapse.

verses.text: 如果撒但自相紛爭，他的國怎能站立得住呢？你們說我靠別西卜趕鬼，

words.note: In a biblical context, often refers to God's or Satan's dominion.
Resultative complement indicating stability or ability to withstand.
Verb-object compound referring to exorcism.

verses.text: 我若靠別西卜趕鬼，你們的子孫趕鬼又靠誰呢？因此，他們必要作你們的審判官。

words.note: A more formal or literary 'if' than '如果'.
Verb-object compound referring to exorcism.
Verb-object compound referring to exorcism.
Indicates a strong certainty or necessity.

verses.text: 我若靠 神的能力趕鬼，這就是 神的國臨到你們了。

words.note: A more formal or literary 'if' than '如果'.
Often preceded by a space for reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Verb-object compound referring to exorcism.
Often preceded by a space for reverence in Chinese Bibles.
In a biblical context, refers to God's dominion or reign.

verses.text: 一個壯漢拿著武器，看守自己的家園，他的家財就平安無事。
但是一個比他更強的人來了，勝過了他，奪去他所倚靠的武器，就把他的家財當作掠物分了。

words.note: Connects adjective to noun.
Indicates the object of the following verb.
Common in biblical context for 'plunder' or 'booty'.

verses.text: 不站在我這一邊的就是反對我的；不跟從一起收聚的就是分散的。

words.note: Indicates 'the one who...'
Indicates 'the one who opposes me'.
Often combined with 起 to mean 'together'.
Indicates 'the one who gathers'.
Indicates 'the one who scatters'.

verses.text: 「一個污靈離開了一個人，走遍乾旱之地，尋找棲身的地方，卻沒有找到，就說：『我要回到我從前離開了的那房子。』

words.note: Refers to evil spirits or demons in a religious context.
Classical Chinese possessive particle, similar to '的'.
Literally 'to perch oneself'.

verses.heading: Response to Jesus’ Work

verses.text: 到了之後，看見裡面已經打掃乾淨，粉飾好了，

words.note: Often means to decorate or whitewash, sometimes implying a superficial appearance.

verses.text: 他就去帶了另外七個比自己更惡的污靈來，進去住在那裡；那人後來的情況，比以前更壞了。」

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.
Often used in moral/religious contexts.
Indicates a new situation or completed change.

verses.text: 耶穌正說這些話的時候，群眾中有一個女人高聲對他說：「懷你胎的和哺養你的有福了！」

words.note: Used as a locative suffix meaning 'among' or 'in the midst of'.
In this context, to conceive a child.
Refers to the act of bearing a child.
Turns a phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the one who...'.
Turns a phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the one who...'.

verses.text: 他說：「是的，卻還不如聽 神的道而遵守的人有福。」

words.note: Emphasizes affirmation; 'yes, it is so'.
Often preceded by a reverence space in Chinese Bibles.
Often refers to divine truth or the Word of God.
Turns a phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the one who...'.

verses.text: 眾人聚集的時候，耶穌就說：「這世代是個邪惡的世代。這世代尋求神蹟，可是除了約拿的神蹟以外，再沒有神蹟給他們了。

words.note: Often refers to a moral or historical period.
Used with '以外' to mean 'except for'.
Often follows '除了...'.

verses.heading: The Sign of Jonah

verses.text: 約拿怎樣成了尼尼微人的神蹟，人子也照樣成為這個世代的神蹟。

words.note: A messianic title for Jesus.

verses.text: 審判的時候，南方的女王要和這世代的人一同起來，她要定他們的罪，因為她從地極來到，要聽所羅門智慧的話。你看，這裡有一位是比所羅門更大的。

words.note: Can be verb 'to judge' or noun 'judgment'
Often combined with 罪 (sin) to mean 'condemn guilt/sin'
位 is a polite measure word for people.

verses.text: 審判的時候，尼尼微人要和這世代的人一同起來，他們要定這個世代的罪，因為尼尼微人聽了約拿所傳的就悔改了。你看，這裡有一位是比約拿更大的。

words.note: Refers to the inhabitants of Nineveh.
Particle introducing a nominalized verb phrase.
Forms a nominal phrase with 所 and 傳, meaning 'that which Jonah preached'.

verses.text: 「沒有人點了燈，把它放在地窖裡，或量器底下，卻放在燈臺上，叫進來的人看得見光。

words.note: Used to move the direct object before the verb.

verses.heading: Internal Light

verses.text: 你的眼睛就是你身體的燈，你的眼睛健全，全身就明亮；如果不健全，全身就黑暗。
所以要謹慎，免得你裡面的光黑暗了。

words.note: Can be a noun 'darkness' or a verb 'to darken'.

verses.text: 你若全身明亮，沒有一點黑暗，你就完全明亮，好像明亮的燈光照你一樣。」
耶穌說話的時候，有一個法利賽人請耶穌和他一起吃飯；他就進去坐席。

words.note: Refers to sitting at a formal banquet or meal.

verses.heading: Rebuking the Pharisees and Experts in the Law

verses.text: 這個法利賽人見耶穌吃飯之前不洗手，覺得奇怪。
主對他說：「你們法利賽人把杯盤的外面洗淨，但你們裡面卻充滿了搶奪和邪惡。

words.note: Marks direct object of a verb.

verses.text: 無知的人哪，那造外面的，不也造裡面嗎？

words.note: Indicates exclamation or appeal.
Here acting as 'the one who'.
Turns preceding phrase into a nominalized clause.

verses.text: 只要把裡面的施捨出去，你們的一切就都潔淨了。

words.note: Specifically refers to giving charitably to the poor.
Functions as a directional complement here.
Often used in religious contexts for ritual or moral purity.

verses.text: 然而你們法利賽人有禍了！因為你們把薄荷、茴香和各樣菜蔬獻上十分之一，卻把公義和愛 神的事疏忽了；這些是你們應當作的，但其他的也不可疏忽。

words.note: Transliteration of 'Pharisaios'.
Literally 'have disaster/misfortune'.
Can refer to dill or fennel.
Often used for religious offerings.
Refers to the religious practice of tithing.
A core theological concept.

verses.text: 你們法利賽人有禍了！因為你們喜愛會堂裡的高位和人在巿中心的問安。

words.note: Transliteration of 'Pharisaios'.
Literally 'have disaster/misfortune'.

verses.text: 你們有禍了！因為你們好像不顯露的墳墓，走在上面的人並不知道。」

words.note: Literally 'have disaster/misfortune'.
Used with 不 (bù) to mean 'not revealed' or 'hidden'.
Used to reinforce negation, meaning 'not at all' or 'simply not'.

verses.text: 律法師中有一個回答他：「老師，你這樣說，把我們也侮辱了！」

words.note: Refers to Jewish legal experts.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「你們律法師也有禍了，因為你們把難擔的擔子叫人擔，自己連一個指頭也不動。
你們有禍了！因為你們修造先知的墳墓，而那些先知正是你們祖先所殺的，
這樣，你們就成了證人，對你們祖先的作為表示同意；他們殺害先知，你們修造先知的墳墓。
所以， 神的智慧說：『我要差遣先知和使徒到他們那裡去，有的他們要殺害，有的他們要迫害，

words.note: The elevated character 　 is a traditional reverence marker for 'God'.

verses.text: 為要使創世以來眾先知所流的血，從亞伯的血起，直到在祭壇和聖所之間受害的撒迦利亞的血為止，都向這一代追討。』是的，我告訴你們，都要向這一代追討。
你們律法師有禍了！因為你們拿去知識的鑰匙，自己不進去，又阻止要進去的人。」

words.note: Refers to Jewish legal experts.
A common biblical expression of condemnation.

verses.text: 耶穌從那裡出來，經學家和法利賽人非常敵視他，質問他很多問題，

words.note: Refers to those who studied and taught the Jewish scriptures.
A Jewish religious and political party in ancient Judea.

words.definition: regard with hostility, be hostile to

verses.text: 等機會從他的口中找把柄。

words.definition: from his mouth, from his lips

words.note: Often used figuratively for a weakness or fault that can be exploited.
